subject: Programming
title: Encryption Algorithms
description: A fast breakdown of Encryption Algorithms for builders.

hook.text: Every time you shop online, algorithms scramble your credit card number so nobody can steal it.

buildup.text: Encryption turns readable text into unreadable gibberish using a mathematical key.

discovery.text: Public-key encryption lets strangers communicate securely without ever sharing a secret key.

twist.text: The security depends on math problems that are easy one way but nearly impossible to reverse.

climax.text: Quantum computers may break today's encryption. New algorithms are being designed to survive them.

punchline.text: Math you can't reverse keeps the internet safe.

quiz.question: What makes public-key encryption secure?
options: Math problems that are hard to reverse
